Due to these extra activities, this might not have an obvious influence on their health, but at least this could help them to avoid bad . Coupled with physical side, their mental wellbeing will also be improved, and the reason is that having someone to take care of would reduce the chance of feeling . Therefore, their could be minimised.In spite of the above advantages, the interaction between pets and vulnerable old people still exist. One of the major concerns is the of these animal on their tracheas, especially those asthma. virtually invisible in the air, many asthma symptoms are caused unconsciously by pets. In addition to the fact that old people might experience difficulty in looking after their pets, as their health conditions are limited, could become even more when they try take care of others.In conclusion, it is true that obstacles still exist for elderly people in adopting pets, but the benefits of this topic its . For such reasons, instead of , further support would be far more beneficial.
llm: As people age, they often experience a decline in physical and mental health, as well as social isolation. However, having a pet such as a cat or a dog can significantly improve their quality of life. The benefits that these lovely animals bring to them, physically and mentally alike, are clearly undeniable. For instance, pets provide companionship, which can help alleviate feelings of loneliness and depression. They also encourage physical activity, such as walking or playing with the pet, which can help maintain mobility and flexibility.Moreover, pets can have a positive impact on mental health by reducing stress and anxiety. The emotional support and affection provided by pets can be particularly beneficial for older adults who live alone or have limited social interaction. Furthermore, pets can also help older adults establish a daily routine, which can provide a sense of purpose and structure.In spite of the above advantages, the interaction between pets and vulnerable old people still exists. One of the major concerns is the impact of these animals on their tracheas, especially those with asthma. Virtually invisible in the air, many asthma symptoms are caused unconsciously by pets. The dander and hair from pets can trigger allergic reactions and exacerbate respiratory problems, making it difficult for older adults to breathe. Therefore, it is essential for older adults to consider their health and well-being before deciding to have a pet. Nevertheless, with proper care and precautions, the benefits of having a pet can far outweigh the potential problems, and many older adults can enjoy a happier, healthier life with their furry companions.

question: Some people believe that homework should not be given to school children. Others, however, say that homework is an important requirement for children to be able to develop appropriately. Discuss both views and give your own opinion.Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your knowledge or experience.You should write at least 250 words.
human: The benefits of giving or not giving homework to children are often debated. Some people feel that children have enough work to do during one day whilst at school, whereas others feel that the more work set, the better.It is true that schools today place more and more demands and pressure on children. The competition to do well, to enter a good university and to get a good job is significant. This has led to the ideology that children should do as much schoolwork as possible in order to help their intellectual development. The argument, however, that more is better is not always valid. There comes a point, especially for a child, when more knowledge cannot be absorbed in a day. When a child has possibly 7 or 8 classes a day on different subjects, he or she is processing a lot of information already. To give more work to be done at home, therefore, would be pointless and even counterproductive. In addition to this, although it is important to be educated, childhood should also be a time when there is an opportunity to just play and enjoy unstructured time. Homework can significantly lessen the possibilities of doing this.On the other hand, it can be argued that there is a place for homework. If study at school is not overdone, the opportunity to look at work again and extend ideas can be an invaluable exercise. It’s easy to forget one thing that has been taught once, but if that concept is revisited a second time, the brain has time to reprocess and likely better understand and remember.It seems to me that there is a place for homework for today’s children. What must be remembered, though, is that homework needs to be limited to age-appropriate parameters, so that a balance can be struck between study and free time and relaxation.
llm: The debate on whether homework should be given to school children has been ongoing for years. Some people believe that homework is unnecessary and that children have enough work to do during the school day. They argue that the school day is already packed with activities and lessons, and that additional homework would only add to the stress and fatigue of young minds. On the other hand, there are those who believe that homework is an essential requirement for children to develop properly. They think that the more work set, the better, as it helps to reinforce learning, improve understanding, and develop important skills such as time management and self-discipline.However, I believe that there is a middle ground to be found. While homework can be beneficial, it is also important to recognize that there comes a point, especially for a child, when more knowledge cannot be absorbed in a day. Children's minds are like sponges, and they can only absorb so much information before they become overwhelmed. Therefore, homework needs to be limited to age-appropriate parameters, taking into account the child's ability to comprehend and process the information.Moreover, excessive homework can lead to a negative attitude towards learning, and may even affect a child's physical and mental health. It is essential to strike a balance between school work and homework, allowing children to have time for relaxation, play, and other activities that are essential for their overall development. In conclusion, while homework can be a useful tool for learning, it should be assigned judiciously, taking into account the age and ability of the child, and should not be used as a means of overloading them with work. By doing so, we can ensure that children develop a positive attitude towards learning, and are able to reach their full potential.

question: Some people believe that preserving natural environment is crucial, but make no effort to do so (reasons and solutions)
human: Some people believe that preserving natural environment is crucial, however, most make no effort to do so. Why do you think this is happening? What are some simple actions that could help the environment?It is commonly believed that preservation of natural resources is imperative, yet most people seem to exert no effort in doing so. Understanding the causes of this negligent attitude may help with devising some simple measures to safeguard the deteriorating environment.Lack of awareness is probably the foremost reason why the vast majority of individuals appears to be unmindful of the current environmental issues. Normally, people have tendency to downplay abstract problems, or those to happen in the distant future. This is because they are not properly informed of the possible detrimental effects of taking the environment for granted. To illustrate, residents in urban areas often deliberately dump their into the nearby creeks and drainage canals causing them to become clogged. It is only when devastating floods strike, that they come to realize the consequences of their actions.Some basic solutions that could be carried out are extensive awareness through all forms of communication and strict implementation of waste management. In addition to the traditional press, social media is a powerful means of disseminating information regarding the impending disasters and their potential hazards. This is a good way of persuading the public to actively take part in the campaign. Another straightforward solution, and by far the least anyone can do to help save the nature is disposing of garbage thoughtfully. Apart from avoiding throwing trash anywhere, everyone should practice proper segregation of biodegradable, non-biodegradable, and recyclable wastes at all times. These actions, when coordinated by the local governments, can be tremendously successful.In conclusion, while individual awareness is key to maintaining a healthy ecosystem, concerted efforts of governments and are much more effective in achieving such goal.The response is well written, it contains reasons, solutions and fully addresses the task. The ideas aren’t repeated, they are conveyed in a clear and easy to understand manner and organised well with sufficient use of cohesive devices. The vocabulary is varied, sentence structures are complex and instances of incorrect grammar are hardly noticeable. Overall, this essay is likely to achieve Band 8 in IELTS.
llm: The preservation of the natural environment is a topic of great importance, with many people acknowledging its significance. However, despite this recognition, most individuals fail to take action to protect the environment. This disparity between awareness and action is a puzzling phenomenon that warrants exploration. In my opinion, the primary reason for this inconsistency is the lack of awareness about the severity of environmental issues and the simple actions that can be taken to mitigate them.Lack of awareness is probably the foremost reason why the vast majority of individuals appears to be unmindful of the current environmental issues. Many people are not fully informed about the consequences of their daily actions on the environment, such as the use of plastic, water consumption, and energy usage. As a result, they do not feel the need to make changes to their lifestyle. Furthermore, the complexity of environmental problems can make them seem overwhelming, leading to a sense of powerlessness among individuals.Fortunately, there are numerous simple actions that can contribute significantly to environmental preservation. For instance, reducing plastic usage by carrying reusable bags and water bottles, turning off lights and electronics when not in use, and conserving water can make a significant difference. Additionally, recycling, using public transport, or carpooling can also help reduce carbon emissions. These actions, although small, can collectively have a substantial impact when adopted by a large number of people. Therefore, it is essential to raise awareness and promote education on environmental issues and the simple yet effective actions that can be taken to address them. By bridging the gap between awareness and action, we can work towards a more sustainable future.

question: Some people believe that the best way to solve environmental problems is to increase the price of fuel.Do you agree or disagree?
human: Raising the price of car fuel is believed by some people to be an excellent method to solve the growing number of environmental issues. However, I strongly disagree with this idea, as doing so would make life difficult for lower-income households. While making fuel more expensive wouldn’t change the habits of wealthy families, switching to fossil fuel alternatives could prove to be much more beneficial for the environment.The most compelling reason against raising the cost of fuel is that the upper classes of society will hardly be affected by rising fuel costs, as this only makes up a minor proportion of their expenditure. They will continue to use their personal vehicles as they wish without a thought for the environment or the higher fuel prices, even if their country has state-of-the-art public transportation.Those who will feel the crunch of this decision are the middle-class and lower-income households, since travelling is a major part of most people’s routine, be it to work, school or shopping. Driving is almost unavoidable in many instances; therefore, raising the price of petrol would only serve to widen the gap between the rich and poor, and serve as an inadvertent form of discrimination.Another reason why increasing the cost of fuel is far from the best way to deal with environmental pollution is that now there are much more viable alternatives. Due to the rapid advances in technology, scientists and engineers have been able to develop several alternatives to fossil fuel, such as cars powered by electricity or naturally produced biofuel. The move to adopt clean energy sources instead of fossil fuels is a much more promising alternative compared to simply making fuel more expensive.In conclusion, I believe that governments of the world should invest more time and money in finding alternatives to fossil fuels that are more environmentally friendly, rather than simply raising the cost of petrol.
llm: The issue of environmental problems has sparked a heated debate on the most effective solution. Some people believe that increasing the price of fuel is the best approach to tackle these issues. However, raising the price of petrol is believed by some to be an excellent method to solve the growing number of environmental issues. On the contrary, I strongly disagree with this idea. In my opinion, increasing the price of fuel would have a disproportionate impact on lower-income households, who rely heavily on fuel for their daily commute and other essential activities. This would lead to a significant increase in their cost of living, making life even more difficult for them. Instead of alleviating environmental problems, this approach would exacerbate social and economic inequalities.I believe that governments around the world should invest more time and money in finding alternatives to fossil fuels that are more environmentally friendly. This could include renewable energy sources such as solar, wind, and hydro power. By promoting and subsidizing these alternatives, governments can encourage individuals and businesses to switch to cleaner energy sources, thereby reducing our reliance on fossil fuels and mitigating environmental problems. Furthermore, investing in alternative energy sources can also create new job opportunities and stimulate economic growth, making it a more sustainable and equitable solution. In conclusion, while increasing the price of fuel may reduce consumption in the short term, it is not a viable long-term solution to environmental problems. Instead, governments should focus on developing and promoting environmentally friendly alternatives to fossil fuels.

question: Some people believe that we cannot learn anything from the past for our life today, while others believe that history is a valuable source of information to understand human's life.Discuss both views and give your opinion.Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.
human: It is true that these days people say there is little we can gain from previous history, whereas others think that history is a key source to understand our lives. Although there are some strong arguments against learning history, I agree with learning history to know life of human.There are two reasons why people think there is nothing to gain from history. Firstly, there is evidence to support the idea that learning history stresses people out. Based on a survey conducted by Standford University, 57 percent of people consider learning past life of humans a primary source of stress, while less than 6 percent of people said studying previous humans' life was not a stressor. Secondly, people may not have time to remember historical events because the constant stimulation and hustle and bustle of society is holding them back from their life. In turn, they are more likely to regard learning history as useless.Despite the negative drawbacks, I support that historical event is great information to comprehend human's life. The main benefit of a historical event is that it can have a positive impact on people, especially children, as they grow up. Since history has more connection and support to our lives, it allows children to become more insightful and knowledgeable and discover advanced perspectives. For example, I have been widening my perspective through historical events in my family or country because gaining history regarding my family and nation taught me the right attitude to understand today. However, if I did not know any history, I would not have had an opportunity to understand human life and self-development. So, learning history should be encouraged.In conclusion, while I recognize the possible disadvantages of learning history, I believe that the benefits of gaining past events far outweigh them in the long term.
llm: The debate about the relevance of history in understanding our lives today has sparked intense discussion among scholars and individuals alike. On one hand, people say there is little we can gain from previous history, arguing that it is outdated and has no bearing on our modern lives. They believe that the world is constantly changing, and what happened in the past has minimal impact on our present and future. On the other hand,, others think that history is a key source to understand our lives, providing valuable lessons and insights that can shape our decisions and actions.Despite the negative drawbacks, I firmly support the view that historical events are a great source of information to comprehend human life. Studying history allows children to become more insightful and knowledgeable, and discover advanced perspectives on the world. By learning from past experiences, we can avoid repeating the same mistakes and instead, build upon the successes of our predecessors. For instance, the consequences of World War II have taught us the importance of diplomacy and international cooperation, while the Civil Rights Movement has shown us the power of perseverance and determination in achieving social justice.Furthermore, history provides a unique window into the complexities of human nature, revealing the motivations, values, and beliefs that have shaped human societies over time. By examining historical events, we can gain a deeper understanding of the intricacies of human behavior, politics, and culture, ultimately enabling us to make more informed decisions about our own lives and the world around us. In conclusion, I firmly believe that history is an indispensable tool for understanding human life, and its study should be encouraged and valued.

question: Some people believe that women should be treated as equal to men when applying for a job with the police or the military, while others disagree (opinion)
human: Some people believe that women should be treated as equal to men when applying for a job with the police or the military. Others think that women are less suitable for this kind of job. Discuss both views and give your opinion.Sample EssayIn recent years gender equality in employment has been the topic of heated debate. While some may argue that women are less suited for certain jobs such as with the police or the military, I believe that female candidates should be treated the same as their male counterparts.Those who consider women to be unsuited for some kinds of jobs including the police or the military often hold that opinion because such jobs are extremely physically demanding. As the female body has smaller muscles and less physical strength compared to male body, women may have difficulty engaging in strenuous activity which can be exhausting even for men. In military service, female soldiers are more likely to struggle while defending themselves than their male peers when they are forced to move around carrying heavy firearms in the battle, which can increase their risk of mission failure. Because of the hazards and extreme conditions they may encounter, some people advocate that women are not suitable for work in these fields.Nevertheless, I believe that female applicants should be considered for police or military placements without a gender bias, because women are more suited to certain tasks. In the police service, female officers can perform important roles on some occasions such as a body search where male officers are restricted from touching female convicts. In the military service, female nursing staff are more likely to care better for injured soldiers since maternal instinct makes them dedicated and heart-warming professionals. Furthermore, for the sake of fairness to all, job seekers should have an equal opportunity to choose their jobs freely, regardless of gender. Many women have the desire to work in the police and the military and some of them have relevant expertise and qualifications. Therefore, they should not be discriminated against in employment opportunities for these jobs.In conclusion, although some say that women are incompatible with police and military duties because of the high physical demands, I believe that they should be treated as equal to men. This is because there are certain roles with the police and the military that are more suitable for women than men, and therefore both genders should have equal employment opportunities.
llm: The debate over whether women should be treated as equal to men when applying for jobs in the police or military has been a longstanding one. On one hand, some people believe that women should have equal opportunities and be treated the same as men when applying for these positions. They argue that women possess the same capabilities, skills, and strengths as men, and should therefore be given the same consideration. This perspective emphasizes the importance of gender equality and challenges traditional stereotypes that have historically excluded women from these roles.On the other hand, others think that women are less suitable for jobs in the police or military. They argue that these occupations require a certain level of physical strength, which they believe women may not possess. Additionally, they may think that women are more emotionally sensitive and therefore less capable of handling the stresses and dangers associated with these jobs. However, this perspective is often based on outdated and sexist assumptions about women's abilities and is not supported by evidence.In my opinion, women should be treated as equal to men when applying for jobs in the police or military. Women have proven themselves to be highly capable and effective in these roles, and there is no reason to believe that they are inherently less suited to these positions. By treating women equally, we can tap into a wider pool of talent and skills, and create a more diverse and effective police force and military. Ultimately, equality and fairness should be the guiding principles in the application process, and women should be given the same opportunities as men to serve and protect their countries.

question: Some people claim that it is acceptable to use animals in medical research (discuss)
human: Some people claim that it is acceptable to use animals in medical research for the benefit of human beings, while others argue that it is wrong. Discuss both views and give your opinion.People have different views on how medical research should be conducted and tested. Although many people support the use of for developing medicines, I personally believe that animal testing is morally wrong.The main reason why some people value to conduct medical research is because animal testing has contributed to many life-saving cures and treatments. It is true that nearly every medical breakthrough in the last 100 years has resulted directly from research using animals. For example, experiments in which dogs had their pancreases removed led directly to the discovery of insulin, critical to saving the lives of diabetics. Furthermore, it is impossible to release to the market before proving it no harm to humans and laboratory mice are appropriate research subjects because they are similar to human beings in many ways.However, I people who consider medical development that involved the use of animals cruel and unacceptable. I believe that the lives of all creatures should be respected and we, humans, have no right to for our own benefits. Governments should invest in developing alternative methods that can replace when doing medical research. For example, a software program can be developed to model a human immune system and new drugs can be tested on the software rather than animals. In this way, no animals will suffer from the medical tests and the society can still benefit from medical development.In conclusion, although it is undoubtedly true that animal testing has helped scientists in drug developments and medical discoveries, I believe that the benefits to humans do not justify the suffering caused to animals and we should use alternative methods when doing medical research that do not involve animals suffering.This is a great essay. It addresses the two sides of the argument by exploring reasons why animals should and should not be used in medical research. The ideas are well explained and supported by examples. The use of paragraphing is efficient and helps with logical sequencing of ideas. Linking words are used appropriately to achieve the necessary cohesion. Author’s meaning is skillfully conveyed by the use of wide range of vocabulary. Even though there are some inaccurately used expressions, they don’t hinder understanding. Most sentences are error-free, instances of faulty grammar are rare. Overall, this essay seems worthy of IELTS Band 8.
llm: The use of animals in medical research has been a contentious issue for years, with some people claiming that it is acceptable for the benefit of human beings. Proponents of animal testing argue that it is essential to advance medical knowledge and develop new treatments for life-threatening diseases. They believe that the benefits of animal testing, including the development of vaccines, antibiotics, and cancer treatments, outweigh the harm caused to the animals. According to them, animal testing is a necessary evil that has saved countless human lives and improved the quality of life for many.On the other hand, opponents of animal testing, including myself, believe that it is morally wrong to subject animals to pain, suffering, and death in the name of medical progress. We argue that alternative methods, such as computer simulations, cell cultures, and human clinical trials, can replace animal testing. Moreover, animals are not always a reliable model for human diseases, and the results of animal tests may not be applicable to humans. Furthermore, animal testing is often inhumane and can cause immense suffering to the animals involved.In my opinion, while I understand the potential benefits of animal testing, I believe that the harm caused to animals outweighs the benefits. I think that scientists should explore alternative methods that do not involve animal suffering. With the advancement of technology, it is now possible to conduct medical research without the need for animal testing. Therefore, I believe that it is our moral obligation to prioritize animal welfare and explore alternative methods that promote human well-being without causing harm to animals. Ultimately, I think that it is time to rethink our approach to medical research and strive for a more compassionate and humane approach.

question: Some people feel that entertainers such as film stars, pop musicians or sports stars are paid too much money.Do you agree or disagree?Which other types of job should be highly paid?Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.
human: Jobs such as actors, musicians or athlete earns a lot of money, however, a part of people argued that these kinds of people are overpaid. In my opinion, I disagree with this view and believes that they deserved the high salary.People who works as a movie stars, musicians and sports player deserved high money paid. This is because they advocated all there time and effort to get the salary that they have today. Before they become famous, they only have few incomes or even get nothing. That is to say, many musicians did not get any payment at the begining of their career, so do the actors and sports players, they spent their time but do not get any money. For instance, before being a well-known musicians, they have to spend their own money on buying equipment to produce musics or to public the songs they have made. Also, the creativety and their works cannot be measured by money. Thus, they deserved high salary because of their profession and uncopyable works.Jobs which needs professional skills and the job envolves high risk shoul also be highly paid. Such as doctors and programmers, their job are unplaceable because these envolved professional knowledge that not everyone had. Moreover, people works in high-risk environment deserved high payment too. For example, fire-fighters, they might got hurt or even die while working. Therefore, higher salary is needed for jobs that need special skills and career with high risk.To sum up, I agree with the statement because of the reasons above, and jobs with special knowledge and people works in dangerous environment should also be highly paid.
llm: The debate about the compensation of entertainers, such as film stars, pop musicians, and sports stars, has sparked intense discussion. While some people believe that these individuals are overpaid, I strongly disagree. In my opinion, the high salaries earned by actors, musicians, and athletes are well-deserved. The reason behind this is that they have devoted their time and effort to hone their craft, often making tremendous sacrifices to reach the pinnacle of their careers. For instance, a professional athlete may have to dedicate years to rigorous training, risking injuries and maintaining a strict regimen to stay at the top of their game.Moreover, the creativity and value that entertainers bring to society cannot be measured solely by monetary terms. The joy, inspiration, and escapism they provide to millions of people around the world are invaluable. Their work has a profound impact on culture, influencing trends, and bringing people together. It's also worth noting that the money they earn is often a result of the revenue they generate through ticket sales, merchandise, and advertising, which creates a ripple effect in the economy, supporting numerous jobs and industries.In addition to entertainers, jobs that require professional skills and involve high risk should also be highly compensated. For example, doctors, firefighters, and astronauts put their lives on the line every day, making crucial decisions that can mean the difference between life and death. Their expertise, bravery, and commitment to serving others warrant high salaries, as they undertake tasks that the average person cannot or would not dare to do. Therefore, while some may view the salaries of entertainers as excessive, I believe they, along with other high-risk and high-skill professions, deserve the financial rewards they receive for their tireless efforts and the significant contributions they make to society.

question: Some people feel that fashion is like art and a significant part of society, while others feel that fashion is a waste of time and money.Discuss both views and give your own opinion.Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your knowledge or experience.You should write at least 250 words.
human: The fashion industry today is an important component of society and people’s lives. It is true that many people care little for clothes and scorn the importance that others attach to them; however, this does not mean that the significance that people give to fashion is a waste of time and money.When one considers that areas of the world suffer from poverty, disease and inadequate access to food and clean water, the emphasis attached to fashion by the developed world can seem out of proportion. Many people would contend that the resources put into developing and creating fashion would be more ethically spent on creating some level of equality in terms of the right to live a healthy and happy life. This point is hard to argue with. However, it is also true that people in the developed world cannot be expected to send all their spending money to people in need and that wanting to look good is an unalterable human trait.The fashion industry contributes to the society much like most other industries. It provides jobs and income to millions of people around the world and the money that changes hands generates taxes that contribute to the fabric of society. There is more to fashion than trying to look better than others and excessive luxury. The high level of fashion is indeed a kind of art form and, like other art forms, there will always be people who appreciate it, want to create it and want to spend money on it. It is part of the development of civilisation and this is not likely to change.I therefore feel that, although the gap between the rich and the poor sometimes makes it seem that fashion is a waste of time and money and an unethical use of resources, fashion is an important part of today’s society and economic output. This leads me to believe that trying to strike a balance between selfish greed and a more altruistic way of living should be an individual choice.
llm: The fashion industry has long been a topic of debate, with some people viewing it as a vital part of society and a form of art, while others see it as a frivolous waste of time and money. On one hand, many argue that the resources devoted to creating and developing fashion could be better spent on more pressing issues, such as creating equality and alleviating poverty. From this perspective, the vast amounts of money and labor invested in the fashion industry seem excessive and misguided, especially when compared to the resources allocated to addressing pressing social and economic issues.However, it is also true that the desire to look good is an unalterable human trait. People have always sought to express themselves and showcase their individuality through their clothing and appearance. The fashion industry today is an important component of society and people's lives, providing a means of self-expression, creativity, and cultural exchange. Fashion has the power to evoke emotions, spark conversations, and bring people together. Moreover, the industry provides employment opportunities and contributes significantly to the economy of many countries. For instance, the fashion industry is a substantial contributor to the GDP of countries like Italy and France, and provides livelihoods for millions of people around the world.In my opinion, fashion is not a waste of time and money, but rather a significant aspect of human culture and society. While it is true that some of the resources devoted to fashion could be redirected towards more pressing issues, it is also important to recognize the value that fashion brings to people's lives and to the economy. By embracing fashion as a form of artistic expression and a means of self-expression, we can appreciate its significance and importance in our lives, while also acknowledging the need for balance and responsibility in the way resources are allocated. Ultimately, fashion is a reflection of human creativity, diversity, and individuality, and its importance should not be underestimated.

question: Some people feel that learning a foreign language is an essential component of a child’s education. Others feel that learning a foreign language is often a waste of time that can be better spent on learning about technology and other more vocational subjects.Discuss both views and give your own opinion.Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your knowledge or experience.You should write at least 250 words.
human: Throughout the history of education, learning a foreign language or languages has been a constant component. Of course, many people feel that this is really an unnecessary part of education for everyone, but this is not a point of view that I share.The opponents to learning a foreign language might argue that most people do not travel that often outside their own country. In addition to this, out of all the countries of the world, comparatively not many share the same language. Therefore, learning a foreign language will only be useful for the very limited time that one spends in a country where this language is used. For some people, the language might never be used in their entire lives. When one thinks about how much time and money are spent training language teachers, buying resources, going on trips and delivering lessons for such a negligible benefit, this would seem to be a very inefficient allocation of resources.However, the benefits of learning a foreign language go further than just the ability to use it from time to time on a holiday or business trip. Firstly, through learning one language, one gains an understanding to some extent of how all languages work. Thus, no matter where people might end up around the world, the knowledge of language can be of use. Secondly, with the study of a foreign language, one also opens oneself up to other cultures. This allows in turn an appreciation for different points of view and belief systems. With an ever-shrinking world due to globalisation, the ability to empathise and understand the people from other countries is vital to reducing conflict and creating a more tolerant society. Finally, quite simply learning languages is excellent for the improvement of general cognitive skills.It seems to me that learning a foreign language, therefore, is more than just gaining the ability to speak a few words of a foreign tongue. It is part of intellectual and social development and needs to be continued for everyone in today’s schools.
llm: The debate about whether learning a foreign language is an essential component of a child's education has sparked intense discussion among educators and parents. On one hand, many people feel that learning a foreign language is really an unnecessary part of education for everyone. They argue that the time and resources spent on language learning could be better utilized on more vocational subjects like technology. However, the benefits of learning a foreign language go further than just the ability to use it from time to time on a holiday or business trip.Through learning one language, one gains an understanding to some extent of how all languages work. This linguistic awareness enables individuals to pick up new languages more easily and appreciate the complexities of language structures. Moreover, learning a foreign language opens oneself up to other cultures, allowing in turn an appreciation for different points of view and belief systems. This cross-cultural understanding is invaluable in today's globalized world, where communication and collaboration across borders are increasingly important.In my opinion, learning a foreign language is a crucial aspect of a child's education. Not only does it enhance career opportunities in a global job market, but it also fosters empathy, tolerance, and open-mindedness. For instance, a student who learns Spanish is not only able to communicate with native Spanish speakers but also gains insight into the rich cultural heritage of Spain and Latin America. By learning a foreign language, individuals can broaden their perspectives, challenge their assumptions, and develop a more nuanced understanding of the world. Therefore, I firmly believe that learning a foreign language is an indispensable part of a child's education, and its benefits extend far beyond the classroom.

question: Some people feel that the design of newly constructed buildings in big cities should be controlled by governments. Others believe those who finance the construction of a building should be free to design it as they see fit.Discuss both these views and give your opinion.Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.
human: It is often argued that governments should involve in construction's design in huge cities, while others argued that governments do not have to retrict the free of designers' imagination if those designs are splendid fit on the cities. I believe that if that were to happen, it would be the positive development. This essay will highlight the both views and give personal opinion from the former argument's side.To begin with latter opinion, although governments have worried about the combination of buildings entirely, the strong limitation about design can cause squandering of designers' skills. There are huge number of competitions about designing building in this society, and the evolution in these fields has developed dramatically. However, if there is a strict criteria on design of building, the majority of intelligences do not need to hammer away to come up with revolutional outline for building.On the other hand, signitured design of the big cities by itself can be the purpose of trevelling as a landmark, and it can be followed by significant economical achievement in the country. To take myself as an example, in 2017, I went to Gold Coast for study automotive engineering, and I was stunnied becaused of the atmosphere which is formed by combination of similar buildings and beach. Furthermore, according to the research from Sydney university, Gold Coast is one of the cities which make a fortune because of marvelous view.To sum up with, I would therefore argue that in spite of the fact that building design restriction can influence on architects negatively, it has a potential ability to make a significant profit in the future.
llm: The design of newly constructed buildings in big cities has been a topic of debate, with some advocating for government control and others pushing for the freedom to design as they see fit. On one hand, those who finance the construction of a building argue that they should have the autonomy to design it according to their preferences and business needs. This perspective emphasizes the importance of individual creativity and innovation in architecture, which can lead to unique and iconic structures that reflect the character of the building's owners.On the other hand, I firmly believe that the design of newly constructed buildings should be controlled by governments. This is because unregulated construction can lead to a lack of cohesion and harmony in the urban landscape, resulting in a disjointed and unattractive cityscape. Furthermore, government control can ensure that buildings are designed with consideration for the environment, public spaces, and the overall aesthetic of the city. For instance, cities like Paris and Rome are famous for their beautifully designed buildings and streets, which are a major draw for tourists. The signature design of these cities is, in itself, a purpose for traveling, making them landmarks that attract visitors from around the world. If left uncontrolled, the construction of new buildings could disrupt the historic and cultural charm of these cities, diminishing their appeal to tourists and residents alike.In conclusion, while the argument for freedom to design has its merits, I believe that government control over the design of newly constructed buildings is essential for maintaining the unique character and charm of big cities. By regulating design, governments can ensure that new constructions blend in with the existing architecture, preserving the city's identity and making it a desirable destination for travelers and a pleasant place to live for residents.

question: Some people feel that with the rise of artificial intelligence, computers and robots will take over the roles of teachers. To what extent do you agree or disagree with this statement?Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your knowledge or experience.You should write at least 250 words.
human: With ever increasing technological advances, computers and robots are replacing human roles in different areas of society. This trend can also be seen in education, where interactive programs can enhance the educational experience for children and young adults. Whether, however, this revolution can also take over the role of the teacher completely is debatable, and I oppose this idea as it is unlikely to serve students well.The roles of computers and robots can be seen in many areas of the workplace. Classic examples are car factories, where a lot of the repetitive precision jobs done on assembly lines have been performed by robots for many years, and medicine, where diagnosis, and treatment, including operations, have also been assisted by computers for a long time. According to the media, it won’t also be long until we have cars that are driven automatically.It has long been discussed whether robots and computers can do this in education. It is well known that the complexity of programs can now adapt to so many situations that something can already be set up that has the required knowledge of the teacher, along with the ability to predict and answer all questions that might be asked by students. In fact, due to the nature of computers, the knowledge levels can far exceed a teacher’s and have more breadth, as a computer can have equal knowledge in all the subjects that are taught in school, as opposed to a single teacher’s specialisation. It seems very likely, therefore, that computers and robots should be able to deliver the lessons that teachers can, including various ways of differentiating and presenting materials to suit varying abilities and ages of students.Where I am not convinced is in the pastoral role of teachers. Part of teaching is managing behaviour and showing empathy with students, so that they feel cared for and important. Even if a robot or computer can be programmed to imitate these actions, students will likely respond in a different way when they know an interaction is part of an algorithm rather than based on human emotion.Therefore, although I feel that computers should be able to perform a lot of the roles of teachers in the future, they should be used as educational tools to assist teachers and not to replace them. In this way, students would receive the benefits of both ways of instruction.
llm: The rise of artificial intelligence has led to the replacement of human roles in various areas of society, with computers and robots taking over tasks that were previously performed by humans. This trend can also be seen in education, where interactive programs and virtual learning tools are being used to enhance the educational experience for children and young adults. While these technological advancements have the potential to revolutionize the way we learn, some people believe that they will eventually replace the role of teachers altogether. However, I disagree with this notion.On one hand, it is undeniable that technology has the ability to make learning more engaging and accessible. Interactive programs can provide personalized learning experiences, offer real-time feedback, and make complex concepts more understandable. For instance, online platforms like Khan Academy and Coursera have made high-quality educational content available to people all over the world. Moreover, virtual teaching assistants can help with tasks such as grading and data analysis, freeing up time for teachers to focus on more critical aspects of education.On the other hand, I firmly believe that the role of a teacher extends far beyond the mere transmission of knowledge. Teachers provide emotional support, guidance, and mentorship, which are essential for the holistic development of students. They also help students develop critical thinking, creativity, and problem-solving skills, which are difficult to replicate with technology alone. Furthermore, teachers play a vital role in shaping the social and emotional skills of students, such as empathy, communication, and teamwork, which are crucial for their future success.In conclusion, while I acknowledge the potential of technology to enhance education, I do not think that computers and robots will completely take over the role of teachers. The nuances of human interaction, empathy, and guidance that a teacher provides are irreplaceable, and it is essential to strike a balance between technology and human instruction to create an optimal learning environment.

question: Some people like to own the place where they live, but other people like to rent where they live. Discuss both views and give your own opinion.Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your knowledge or experience.You should write at least 250 words.
human: The debate over whether it is better to own or rent the property in which one lives is one that has strong supporters on each side. There are persuasive arguments for both points of view.One of the main advantages of renting a property is flexibility. Usually, a tenant only has to give a month’s notice before changing where he or she lives. If a property is owned and a change is needed, the property must be put onto the market and it is frequently a long and stressful process to get a sale completed. Sometimes, the wrong time of year or a bad market can mean that a sale is not possible. Another advantage of renting is that a large amount of a family’s capital is not tied up in the property. Property can cost hundreds of thousands of dollars and often a lot more. If one rents, this money can be spent on other things to help improve the family’s quality of life. If the property is on a mortgage, then the deposit, also often very large, is tied up in the property and the pressure of having to make substantial payments every month can cause a lot of stress.Owning a property does have various advantages, though. Even though people usually have to service a mortgage every month with payments, this money is then built up with the property. With renting, the money is lost to the landlord, but at the end of the term of the mortgage, the whole property is owned by the family. This makes the process of living in a property a type of investment. In addition, the property’s value often goes up after time, frequently creating a substantial profit. Owning the property where one lives can also create a sense of well-being and self-actualisation.The decision to whether one rents or owns the property in which one lives really boils down to individual preference. My opinion is that it is much more preferable to own a property, mainly because it creates a valuable asset for the family.
llm: The debate over whether it is better to own or rent the property in which one lives is one that has strong supporters on each side. On the one hand, there are those who advocate for renting, citing the numerous benefits it provides. One of the main advantages of renting a property is flexibility. Renters are not tied to a specific location for an extended period, allowing them to move freely to different parts of the country or even abroad if their job or personal circumstances require it. This flexibility is particularly beneficial for young professionals or individuals with uncertain career paths.Another advantage of renting is that a large amount of a family's capital is not tied up in the property. This means that families can invest their money in other assets, such as stocks, bonds, or education, which can potentially yield higher returns. Moreover, renters are not responsible for maintenance and repair costs, which can be a significant financial burden. However, in my opinion, these advantages do not outweigh the benefits of owning a property. My opinion is that it is much more preferable to own the property because it creates a valuable asset for the family. Over time, the value of the property is likely to appreciate, providing a significant source of wealth. Additionally, owning a property gives individuals and families a sense of stability and permanence, allowing them to put down roots and become a part of their community. While there are valid arguments on both sides, I firmly believe that the long-term benefits of owning a property make it the more desirable option.

question: Some people prefer to spend their lives doing the same things and avoiding changes. Others, however think that change is always a good thing. Discuss both sides and give your own opinion.

For the elders, concentration on their favorite activities would give rise to a sense of enjoyment and security, which is helpful to physical and psychological health. Due to a stable life, the elderly are less exposed to stress, leading to a decrease in adrenal hormones and resulting in their well-.Furthermore, degeneration of mental and physical function would make the elderly unlikely to adapt to external changes, causing and , which are not contributing to their health.Above all, it is unlikely to describe the changes in life with a positive or negative term. Accommodation for personal needs and goals is more important than the changes themselves.
llm: The concept of an ideal lifestyle has sparked a heated debate among people, with some advocating for a stable and routine-oriented life, while others believe that change is always a good thing. On one hand, a stable lifestyle can provide a sense of security and comfort, allowing individuals to establish a consistent daily routine and build strong relationships. This approach can be particularly beneficial for the elderly, who have undergone various challenges in their lives and may now prefer a steady and predictable lifestyle.On the other hand, changes can be highly beneficial, especially for young people who are just starting their careers. Exposing themselves to a wide range of experiences and challenges can foster personal growth, creativity, and innovation. Frequent changes can help young individuals develop adaptability, resilience, and a broader perspective, which are essential skills in today's fast-paced and ever-evolving world. In my opinion, whether changes are needed should be determined by the stage of life one is at. For young people, changes can be a catalyst for development and progress, while for the elderly, a stable lifestyle can be a well-deserved rest after a lifetime of hard work and challenges.Ultimately, a balance between stability and change is crucial for a fulfilling life. While some people may thrive in a stable environment, others may need changes to stay motivated and engaged. By acknowledging the different needs and preferences at various stages of life, we can create a more inclusive and supportive society that values both consistency and innovation. In conclusion, whether an ideal lifestyle should be stable or include a wide range of changes depends on individual circumstances and stages of life, and striking a balance between the two is essential for a happy and fulfilling life.

question: Some people say education is the only critical factor to the development of a country. To what extent do you agree or disagree with this statement?

llm: The statement that education is the only critical factor to the development of a country is a subject of debate among scholars and policymakers. While I agree that education plays a vital role in the development of a country, I do not entirely concur that it is the only critical factor.Education is a key factor for the development of a country, as it enables individuals to acquire knowledge, skills, and competencies necessary for economic growth, social progress, and political stability. Educated citizens are more likely to contribute to the development of their country by being productive, innovative, and active participants in the labor market. For instance, some countries have realized that education is the key to the globalization process, as it equips their citizens with the skills and knowledge required to compete in the global economy. Countries like South Korea, Singapore, and Finland have made significant investments in education and have reaped the benefits of a highly skilled and educated workforce.However, other factors such as infrastructure development, economic policies, and political stability also play a crucial role in the development of a country. A country with a well-educated population but inadequate infrastructure, poor economic policies, and political instability is unlikely to achieve significant development. Therefore, while education is a critical factor, it is not the only one. A combination of education, good governance, and economic development is necessary for a country to achieve sustainable development. In conclusion, education is a vital component of a country's development, but it is not the sole factor. Other elements must also be considered to ensure a country's overall growth and prosperity.

question: Some people say free time activities for children should be organized by parents. Others say that children should be free to choose what they do in their free time. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
human: Whether parents should fully intervene in their children's organization of their leisure time or let them decide it, remains a big discussion. In this essay I will contrast the two opinions and I will explain why I think a good balance is needed.One of the reasons supporting the first view is the idea of the undeveloped children's ability to organize. This is because, although some of them might seem very mature for their age, others might struggle understanding the importance of having a routine, besides playing video games. For instance, many parents orientate their children helping them to organize hobbies and teaching a very important skill, time managment.On the other hand, some people encourage children to decide themselves what to do as this stimulates creativity and personal growth. This view, therefore, opens a new world for the little ones who can decide whatever they like, having multiple options. For example, children in this situation quite often are supported when they want to play sports or participate in a painting class.In my opinion, parents should not only be envolved as much as they can in all aspects of their children's lives, but also they might encourage the little ones to have personal opinions and decision about their hobbies and leisure actitivities. This may be a good way to build trust and communication between parents and children. Moreover, children learn responsability while being guided by their parents.In conclusion, some parents help their children more in scheduling their free time, while others intervene less leaving them to create a routine freely. I believe, parents should always be involved in their children's lives and decisions, allowing children participation too, which brings multiple benefits to their relationship.

On one hand, some people argue that parents should take an active role in scheduling their children's free time, as it helps them develop important life skills and ensures their safety. On the other hand,, others believe that children should be given the freedom to choose what they do in their free time, allowing them to explore their interests and develop independence.Some parents help their children more in scheduling their free time, enrolling them in various extracurricular activities and sports, while others intervene less, leaving them to create a routine freely. This approach allows children to make their own decisions and take responsibility for their actions. However, the lack of parental guidance can lead to children spending excessive amounts of time on screens or engaging in unhealthy habits.In my opinion, parents should not only be involved as much as they can in all aspects of their children's lives, including their free time. By doing so, parents can provide their children with a sense of structure and security, while also allowing them to make choices and learn from their mistakes. Parents can help their children discover their passions and interests, and provide them with opportunities to develop new skills. Moreover, parental involvement can also help children develop important life skills such as time management, prioritization, and decision-making. Ultimately, striking a balance between parental guidance and children's independence is crucial for raising well-rounded and responsible individuals. By being actively involved in their children's lives, parents can help them make the most of their free time and set them up for success in the future.

question: Some people say that all popular TV entertainment programmes should aim to educate viewers about important social issues. To what extent do you agree or disagree with this statement?
human: It is often said that all influential TV entertainment programs should be geared towards raising people’s awareness about social issues that matter. While some TV programs could be suitable for this purpose, I disagree with the view that it should be mandatory for all of them, as the decision whether to do so must take into account the nature of the TV content and the channel’s audience.There is a large group of professionals who would benefit from deepening their understanding of what is happening in the world. Stock traders and bankers, for example, must always keep track of numerous business trends on a global scale, and they would appreciate this type of information on their favourite TV shows. Young people are another suitable audience due to the fact that they enjoy learning about popular topics from TV programmes. For instance, SDGs or the Sustainable Development Goals has now become an important topic to learn for children at school. Educational TV would provide a welcome alternative to textbooks, making learning more fun.Despite the potential advantages of incorporating educational content in TV programs, it is important to remember that the purpose of entertainment TV is for people to escape reality, to take a break from their hectic lives. Being reminded about some troubling social issues would not be appreciated by those who just want to unwind after a long day at work. Another consideration is how the content is perceived by the audience, because broadcasting serious topics as part of a comedy show might lead some viewers to believe they are of lesser significance. This would make TV shows of light-hearted nature a poor choice for inclusion of content on pressing social issues.In conclusion, entertainment TV programs can be an effective form of education for some people and a great tool to spread information. However, not all of them should be used for this purpose as there are various ways people appreciate them.
llm: The notion that all popular TV entertainment programmes should aim to educate viewers about important social issues has sparked a heated debate. While I agree that entertainment TV programs can be an effective form of education for some people, I disagree that all of them should be used for this purpose.On the one hand, TV entertainment programmes can be a valuable tool for raising awareness about significant social issues, such as discrimination, inequality, and environmental concerns. By incorporating educational content into their storylines, these programmes can reach a vast audience and inspire positive change. Moreover, they can make complex issues more accessible and engaging, especially for those who may not be interested in traditional educational formats. For instance, a popular TV show can tackle a social issue in a way that is both entertaining and thought-provoking, encouraging viewers to think critically about the topic.On the other hand, not all TV entertainment programmes should be used for educational purposes. There are various ways people appreciate these programmes, and some viewers may simply want to relax and be entertained without being educated. Additionally, if all programmes were to focus on educating viewers, it could lead to a lack of diversity in the types of shows available, potentially boring or overwhelming audiences. People have different preferences when it comes to TV shows, and some may prefer to watch programmes that are purely entertaining, without any educational value. Therefore, it is essential to strike a balance between educational content and entertainment value, allowing viewers to choose the type of programme that suits their interests and needs.In conclusion, while TV entertainment programmes can be an effective form of education, it is not necessary or desirable for all of them to aim to educate viewers about important social issues. A mix of educational and purely entertaining programmes would be more beneficial, catering to the diverse tastes and needs of audiences. By doing so, TV entertainment programmes can continue to educate and engage viewers, while also providing a platform for relaxation and entertainment.

question: Some people say that arts subjects are as essential as academic ones and should be part of school syllabus (agree/disagree)

In other words, schools measured my academic abilities using academic subjects, not art subjects. Liberal arts, which include cultural understanding and knowledge, also include other arts subjects. In addition, we are living in the era of automation and artificial intelligence which are replacing human labor and office work more and more. In this regard, human creativity becomes more important. Therefore, art subjects are being more in demand to make a difference between individuals and computers.In conclusion, academic and arts subjects should blend in a school syllabus in a balanced way. Art subjects can also a better personality in individuals, so participation in these classes should be encouraged as well as academic achievements.The writer explored the reasons why including arts subjects in school syllabus is a good idea, while fluently expressing ideas and supporting them by examples. Correct paragraphing assists with orderly presentation of information, making this essay easy to follow; the range of vocabulary is quite wide. Accuracy of expression needs a bit more attention (see corrections underlined in blue), but overall, this essay could achieve IELTS Band 8.
llm: The debate about the importance of arts subjects in schools has been ongoing, with some people arguing that they are as essential as academic ones and should be part of the school syllabus. Some people say that art subjects such as music, drama, and creative writing are fundamentals that enrich our lives, fostering creativity, imagination, and self-expression. These subjects provide students with a platform to explore their talents, develop their critical thinking skills, and cultivate their emotional intelligence.However, some parents argue that schools should focus on teaching more academic subjects, such as mathematics, science, literature, and history, which they believe are more practical and essential for future careers. They contend that these subjects provide students with a solid foundation in critical thinking, problem-solving, and analytical skills, which are crucial for success in an increasingly competitive world.In my opinion, both academic and arts subjects should be taught in schools. Arts subjects complement academic subjects, providing students with a well-rounded education that encompasses both intellectual and creative development. By incorporating arts subjects into the curriculum, students can develop their imagination, creativity, and innovation, which are essential skills for the 21st century. Moreover, the arts subjects can help students to develop their emotional intelligence, empathy, and social skills, which are vital for building strong relationships and achieving personal and professional success. Therefore, I firmly believe that arts subjects are as essential as academic ones and should be an integral part of the school syllabus, providing students with a holistic education that prepares them for a lifetime of learning, growth, and success.

question: Some people say that modern technology has made shopping today easier, while others disagree. Discuss both views and give your opinion
human: It is commonly argued that the fast pacing technology has helped people do shopping at the present time more easily. However, some people think online shopping is really difficult for them. This essay will consider both the advantages and disadvantages of the use of technology for shopping.One disadvantage of online shopping can be mentioned is that people cannot familiarize themselves with online applications for ordering essential goods and food. In fact, the elderly are not good at technology enough to go to virtual supermarkets. Besides, those who live in remote areas are not accessible easily to technology to buy online groceries.Despite its disadvantage, online shopping has brought about advantages for those who are technology natives. Firstly, it can be time-saving. In fact, shoppers can order any things they need with some clicks on the items, payment method, and time of delivery. Especially in a lingering Covid-19, when social distancing measures have been effective in some places in Viet Nam, according to a survey, the number of online shoppers has been increasing day by day, and thus many applications have been into existence, developed, and thrived.Another advantage of virtual shopping is that it can be life-saving to many people in a pandemic across nations. Going to supermarkets can be detrimental to buyers due to the spread of viruses and the higher risk of infection. For example, in order to buy bread for breakfast, people have to go out for it and thus may be exposed to infectious or incubated victims of Covid-19. Moreover, with preventive measures of Covid-19 containment, such as people not being allowed to go out for their essential goods, if they do not know how to make an online order, it is really difficult for them to survive during a pandemic.In conclusion, the use of technology for virtual shopping is beneficial to our time-saving and life-saving matters, though it is not familiar to some people. In my opinion, thanks to its advantages, I will continue to go shopping online, though the world has gone through the Covid-19 pandemic successfully.
llm: The advent of modern technology has revolutionized the way people shop, with some arguing that it has made shopping easier, while others disagree. On the one hand, some people think that online shopping is really difficult for them, as they may not be familiar with the digital platforms or may have limited access to the internet. This can lead to frustration and a preference for traditional brick-and-mortar stores. Additionally, older generations or those living in rural areas may struggle with online transactions, making shopping more challenging for them.On the other hand, despite its disadvantages, online shopping has brought about numerous advantages for those who are technology natives. For instance, online shopping platforms offer a wide range of products, competitive prices, and convenient delivery options, making it easier for people to shop from the comfort of their own homes. Furthermore, online shopping can be life-saving to many people in a pandemic across nations, as it allows them to purchase essential items without having to physically visit stores, thereby reducing the risk of exposure to the virus.In my opinion, modern technology has indeed made shopping easier for the majority of people. The benefits of online shopping, such as convenience, flexibility, and accessibility, outweigh the drawbacks. Moreover, as technology continues to advance, online shopping platforms are becoming increasingly user-friendly, making it easier for people of all ages and backgrounds to navigate and make purchases. Overall, while there may be some challenges associated with online shopping, the advantages it offers make it an invaluable tool for modern shoppers, and its importance has been further highlighted during the pandemic.

question: Some people say that the experiences a child has before starting school have the most influence on their future life. Others say that experiences as a teenager, especially at school, are more influential. Discuss both views and give your own opinion?

Some people say that the experiences a child has before starting school have the most influence on their future life. They argue that the formative years, typically between birth and age five, lay the foundation for cognitive, social, and emotional development. During this period, children learn to navigate their surroundings, form attachments, and develop essential skills that will serve as the building blocks for future success.Others say that experiences as a teenager, especially at school, are more influential. They contend that adolescence is a time of significant physical, emotional, and psychological change, where individuals begin to explore their identities, form meaningful relationships, and develop a sense of purpose. School, in particular, plays a critical role in shaping a teenager's worldview, providing opportunities for socialization, and fostering academic and personal growth. In the following paragraph, I will discuss both views and give my opinion. In my opinion, both perspectives have merit, and it is difficult to pinpoint a single stage as the most influential. However, I tend to agree that the experiences before starting school have a profound impact, as they establish the groundwork for future development. Nevertheless, experiences during adolescence, particularly at school, also play a vital role in shaping an individual's future. Ultimately, it is the cumulative effect of experiences across various stages of life that molds a person's future, and it is essential to recognize the significance of both early childhood and adolescent experiences in shaping the trajectory of one's life.

question: Some people think history has nothing or little to tell us, but others think that studying the past history can help us better understand the present. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
human: With the development of technology, an increasing number of people try to acquire the latest technology such as computer programming, rather than to study history. There is a debate whether studying histroy could give us more advantages to understand the present society. In my opinion, obtaining knowledge of past history would be definitely helpful for us to live well in society today. I hold this opinion for two reasons, which I will elaborate on in the following essay.To begin with, looking back on history would give us the opportunity to notice mistakes which human beings used to make in the past. Specifically, all kinds of people and countries around the world had made innumerable mistakes throughout history. Besides, some of these mistakes might result in a huge number of victims. Therefore, human beings must avoid these tragedic events happening again. Above all, only knowing history could lead to avoidance of the recurrences. To be more specific, World War must be one of the serious events in human being history, and understanding of this truth have a significant impact on how we should live not to cause war again in the present society. It is manifest that leaning history is meaningful in this regard.On the other hand, some arguments can be made that old stories have little something to do with our present lives. However, closer examination would reveal that all the relationships present today originally come from something in the past. Knowing history enables us to find the best way to a fruitful future. The compelling example of this is racial discrimination in the U.S. Understanding the U.S. history could give us the best manner not to deteriorate relationships in the U.S. I suppose that studying history would be helpful for all human beings from this aspect.Having considered all the arguments above, learning history would be a major contributor to a better understanding of the present because we can know how to avoid the same mistake people used to made and how we should behave for the better result through history.
llm: The relevance of studying history has sparked a heated debate among scholars and individuals alike. Some argue that history has little to offer in terms of understanding the present, while others firmly believe that examining the past can provide invaluable insights into contemporary society. In my opinion, obtaining knowledge of past history would be definitely helpful for us to live well in society today.I hold this opinion for two reasons. Firstly, studying history allows us to learn from past mistakes and successes, which can inform our decisions and actions in the present. By analyzing historical events, we can identify patterns and trends that have shaped the world we live in today. This understanding can help us avoid repeating past errors and instead, build upon the achievements of previous generations. For instance, the study of historical economic crises can provide valuable lessons on how to navigate and mitigate the effects of similar events in the present.Secondly, history provides a rich context for understanding the complexities of modern society. It helps us comprehend the evolution of social, cultural, and political norms, which in turn enables us to better navigate the intricacies of our contemporary world. By studying history, we gain a deeper appreciation for the diversity and plurality that exist within our societies, fostering empathy, tolerance, and more informed civic engagement. In conclusion, while there may be a debate about the utility of studying history, I firmly believe that it offers significant advantages in understanding the present. By learning from the past, we can build a more informed, empathetic, and progressive society. Therefore, I strongly advocate for the continued study and appreciation of history as a vital component of a well-rounded education.
